intro: Cardamine cordifolia subsp. lyallii, commonly known as Lyall's heartleaf watercress, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cross-shaped flowers and seed pods. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a peppery, aromatic quality, similar to other members of the watercress genus. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori cuisine.
